profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born in Madison (then Culpeper) County, Va., January 23, 1784; studied law; was admitted to the bar in Madison County April 10, 1809; member of the Virginia house of delegates, 1812-1838, and served as speaker, 1817-1838; unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Virginia, 1822; elected as a Democrat to the Twenty-fifth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of John M. Patton; reelected to the Twenty-sixth Congress and served from April 28, 1838, to March 3, 1841; presented credentials as a Member-elect to the Twenty-seventh Congress and served from March 4, 1841, until December 6, 1841, when he was succeeded by William Smith, who contested the election; was not a candidate for renomination in 1842; resumed the practice of law; served as a colonel in the Virginia Militia; was drowned while attempting to ford the Conway River near Wolftown, Madison County, Va., January 13, 1842; interment in the family burying ground on his estate, Vale Evergreen, near Graves Mill, Madison County, Va.

note.content: Served until December 6, 1841; succeeded by William Smith, who contested his election.
Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of John M. Patton, and took his seat May 19, 1838.

researchRecord.name: In the Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection, ca. 1838-1840, 2 letters.
In the Colvin Papers, 1734-1839, 97 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Linn Banks. An inventory is available in the repository.
